item.title: Why Do We Pair? - Tech Talk
item.description: The project I'm currently assigned to encourages pair programming as an engineering principal. In this talk, you'll hear story about me and my partner doing the classic weekend chores together. I trialled a brief experiment to see how efficient we could be by mixing up ownership and responsibilities of each task. At the end of this talk, you'll hear from questions from the Sainsbury's Tech division asking more about the SmartShop project I'm working on and hopefully deeper insight in how we function as a team.

item.title: How I Became a Lead Engineer
item.description: How I became a Lead Engineer When people ask me how I became a Lead, I often give them the short story of “I'm not so sure myself”, then be a little modest, rambling how it wasn't 100% in my hands. But only recently I've noticed that there are other engineers aspiring to lead one day, and it's only fair to give a thorough explanation to how and why it happened.

item.title: Mental Health and Fitness
item.description: Mental Health and Fitness Growing up as an only child, I was spoilt compared to the other kids at my school. I didn't have to share any of my belongings at home, and I could play with them until I got told off to go to bed. It was so easy at that age to slip into isolation and just play all by myself. I was a bit of a chubby kid, I enjoyed sports when I was at school and tried joining different football teams but never really kept up the momentum.

item.title: Hello Blog!
item.description: Hi there üëã I never really thought I'd be one to write and talk about myself. I've always had a habit of locking away my thoughts and processing them over and over until I get distracted by something else to think about. So, this blog is really another form of expression about the topics I often analyse (or over-analyse) in my day-to-day work and personal life. As you probably know, after I left University all those years ago, I began a career in Software Engineering.
